HTML & CSS

Here are some useful HTML and CSS resources

CSS Tricks

Visit

CSS Tricks is a great resource for learning CSS. CSS Tricks covers everything you need to know from transitions to gradients. Their Guide to Flexbox is a guide I refer to almost every time I use Flexbox.

Bootstrap

Visit

Bootstrap is among the most popular CSS frameworks to work with. Bootstrap allows you to develop your site with lightning speed, providing you with responsive layouts in no time at all.

Bootswatch

Visit

Bootswatch provides a number of pre-configured styles you can rapidly apply to your website. Bootswatch is based on Bootstrap. The website is filled with multiple examples of layout and code.

Materialize

Visit

Materialize is a CSS framework that enables you to create responsive websites that are designed to give your users a smoother experience as they use your site. Materialize is well documented and easy to learn and utilize.

Sass

Visit

Sass is a CSS precompiler that takes the pain out of coding CSS. It enables you to use features such as mixins, extensions, loops, conditionals and variables (among other tricks) and uses Ruby to compile your Sass files to CSS.

Less

Visit

Less is a CSS precompiler that uses JavaScript to convert your code to CSS. Like Sass, Less provides more features like mixins, conditionals and variables and makes CSS coding faster and easier to read.

Normalize

Visit

Normalize is a stylesheet that helps, well, normalize the differences between browsers. This will help give your users a more consistent experience across browsers.

CSS Reset

Visit

CSS Reset is a stylesheet that helps minimize the differences between browsers. This will help give your users a more consistent experience across browsers.
